programme.title: Ocean's Weirdest
programme.desc: Dive deep into the most misguided attempts to find love that the ocean‚Äôs animals have to offer.

programme.title: Ocean's Weirdest
programme.desc: In the world‚Äôs wettest arena, the Predation Games are underway. It‚Äôs play or get played, and the only prize is survival. .

programme.title: National Parks: USA
programme.desc: In the wake of the largest volcanic eruption of the 1900s, an exploration by National Geographic led to the founding of Katmai National Park. From the volcanic ashes, the landscape regenerated, and a vibrant assembly of wildlife emerged. Witness the annual journey of brown bears, wolves, and salmon within the park.

programme.title: Thailand's Wild Side
programme.desc: The need to breed drives all life across the wilds of Thailand. Animals are pushed to their limits in the pursuit of a perfect partner, but getting a mate is just the first step. Bringing up baby takes commitment and hard work. Parents must keep them safe from danger, find them enough to eat and teach them the skills they'll need to survive.

programme.title: Ocean's Weirdest
programme.desc: Dive deep into the most misguided attempts to find love that the ocean‚Äôs animals have to offer.

programme.title: Ocean's Weirdest
programme.desc: In the world‚Äôs wettest arena, the Predation Games are underway. It‚Äôs play or get played, and the only prize is survival. .

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin leaves the Australian mainland to discover which of the island-dwelling animals is truly built to survive. First up, he meets the enigmatic green turtle on the Wellesley Islands. Next, he is on K‚ÄôGari (Fraser Island), where he tracks down a pack of the notorious dingoes. Finally, he encounters the formidable and aptly named death adder snake.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads along the cliffs and sandy flats of the Australian coast to discover which animal dominates the shoreline. His first encounter is with a white -bellied sea eagle, a bird with extremely sharp talons, followed by the estuarine stonefish, the most venomous fish in the world. Finally, Phil takes a closer look at the notorious stingray.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: Ain't love grand? Well, to many animals in the wild, attracting a mate and getting the chance to breed is more like a blood sport. The mating urge drives animals to make long journeys, to let down their guard in the presence of predators, and even to fight each other to the death.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: With the arrival of spring, animals from all over the South Atlantic are suddenly converging on the Falklands. The striated cara-cara is one of the few year-round inhabitants of the islands.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: Each year, monarch butterflies undertake a multi-generational migration from Mexico all the way to Canada and back again. .

programme.title: Winter's Hidden Wonders
programme.desc: Winter in Europe sees temperatures plummet to minus 40 degrees; wildlife pushed to the extreme. Animals here have little choice but to adapt or die.

programme.title: Katavi - Africa's Fallen Paradise
programme.desc: Katavi is in the grips of extraordinary drought. A new litter of lion cubs is born into tough conditions, vulnerable to the attack of a rogue male, intent on taking over the pride. Water levels drop by the day, pushing two hippos to overthrow an alpha bull. Distant storms bring not rain but fire sparked by lightning. In the crushing heat, life desperately struggles to hold out for rain.

programme.title: India's Wild Leopards
programme.desc: India is home to masters of stealth that prowl the deepest jungles and the highest mountains. Journey to Ladakh within the Himalayas in search of snow leopards ‚Äì the ghost of the mountains ‚Äì and venture into the realm of the smallest of big cats ‚Äì the clouded leopard ‚Äì within the jungles of Northeast India. Wildlife cameraman Sandesh Kadur is on a mission to uncover their secretive lives..

programme.title: Katavi - Africa's Fallen Paradise
programme.desc: Katavi‚Äôs wetlands are unrecognizable in a prolonged drought, reduced to fetid, overcrowded mud wallows. At last, rains resurrect the river, inch by inch. Tensions wash away as hippos and crocodiles rejoice in the return of deep water ‚Ä¶ but flooding traps lion cubs in a precarious position. Normality will finally return to Katavi, but amidst global climate change, for how long?.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Its Mothers Day! Dr. Pol and Dr. Brenda rush to the aid of animals struggling to give birth, while Dr. Lisa treats a cow suffering from a postpartum emergency. Two puppies get poked for their vaccines, and two older dogs come in with quills stuck all over their bodies. As Mothers Day approaches, Doc and Charles cook up a special treat for Diane and Beth. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol welcomes a new vet to the clinic just in time to help the team with a wave of cases. Dr. Pol treats a local K9 deputys injured paw, Dr. Nicole examines a service dog after a scuffle, Dr. Lisa stitches up a horse with a large laceration, and Dr. Brenda soothes a cats burned limb. On her second day on the job, Dr. Olivia jumps into action and helps Dr. Lisa with a cow in labor. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: A Chihuahua in emergency labor has Dr. Nicole on high alert as she attempts to save the mother and puppies. The clinic reels in a curious case of a cat and a fishhook, while a preemie goat and a spooked trail horse both need care for their ailing eyes. Dr. Pol weighs in on an age-old debate: crunchy or smooth?.

programme.title: Wild Arctic
programme.desc: This is the planet‚Äôs most extreme wilderness. Here in the Arctic, creatures carve out a grueling existence amongst vast snow-forests and the brutal tundra. During winter, the Arctic Ocean locks these lands in ice and 24 hours of night, but summer brings around the clock sun, and the ocean and its islands burst into life attracting animals from all over the globe, for a summer feeding frenzy.

programme.title: Wild Arctic
programme.desc: Home to a trillion trees, the boreal forest encircles the entire globe. Bears, wolves, and hummingbirds emerge, hoping to take part in a feeding frenzy, in the largest forest on earth.
